question.text: Which one of the following categories of animals, is correctly described with no single exception in it?

options.text: All reptiles possess scales, have a three-chambered heart and are poikilothermal.
All bony fishes have four pairs of gills and an operculum on each side.
All sponges are marine and have collared cells.
All mammals are viviparous and possess diaphragm for breathing.

solution.text:
A All reptiles possess scales and are poikilothermal. They have a three chambered heart EXCEPT Crocodile, which has a four-chambered heart.

B Bony fishes belong to the Class Osteicthyes of Phylum Chordata. All fishes belonging to this class have four pair of gills and an operculum on each side. There is no exception in them.

C Sponges belong to the Phylum Porifera. They have collared cells known as chanocytes. Sponges are generally marine but some of them may even be found in fresh water. Eg: Spongilla is a fresh water sponge.

D Mammals possess a diaphragm for breathing. They are generally viviparous EXCEPT Platypus (Orinthorhynchus) which is an oviparous mammal.

Thus, option B is the correct option.
